queries.description: Forming or using an out-of-bounds pointer is undefined behavior and can result in invalid memory accesses.
queries.name: Do not form or use out-of-bounds pointers or array subscripts

ARR30-C.title: Do not form or use out-of-bounds pointers or array subscripts

queries.description: Passing out-of-bounds pointers or erroneous size arguments to standard library functions can result in out-of-bounds accesses and other undefined behavior.
queries.name: Guarantee that library functions do not form invalid pointers

ARR38-C.title: Guarantee that library functions do not form invalid pointers

queries.description: Use of string manipulation functions from <string.h> with improper buffer sizes can result in out-of-bounds buffer accesses.
queries.name: Use of the string handling functions from <string.h> shall not result in accesses beyond the bounds

RULE-21-17.title: Use of the string handling functions from <string.h> shall not result in accesses beyond the bounds of the objects referenced by their pointer parameters

queries.description: Passing a size_t argument that is non-positive or greater than the size of the smallest buffer argument to any function in <string.h> may result in out-of-bounds buffer accesses.
queries.name: The size_t argument passed to any function in <string.h> shall have an appropriate value

RULE-21-18.title: The size_t argument passed to any function in <string.h> shall have an appropriate value
